state_summary: Phia's AI-powered shopping assistant helps users discover, shop and buy online by providing personalized recommendations, price comparisons and sustainability factors. Its founders used their own struggles with online shopping to identify a market opportunity.
evidence: The founders, Phoebe Gates and Sophia Kianni, understood e-commerce because they had spent hours trying to find the right items to expand their wardrobe.
The tool, available as a browser extension and app, lets shoppers compare prices, including for second-hand items, adding a sustainability factor to the shopping experience.
Buying second-hand represents an 80% reduction in carbon footprint, compared with buying new.
keywords: online shopping, AI, personal shopper, price comparisons, sustainability
